EXEC sp_describe_first_result_set N'SELECT
    TOP 100 *
    FROM
        OPENROWSET(
            BULK ''https://syanpsecoursedlblaise.dfs.core.windows.net/nyc-taxi-data/raw/taxi_zone.csv'',
            FORMAT = ''CSV'',
            PARSER_VERSION = ''2.0'',
            HEADER_ROW = TRUE,
            FIELDTERMINATOR='','',
            ROWTERMINATOR=''\n''
        ) AS [result]'

-- NEED TO RUN THE MAX COL LENGTH ON EACH OF THE COLUMNS TO FIND OUT WHAT THE MAX COLUMN SIZES ARE

SELECT
    MAX(LEN([Borough])) AS borough_len,
    MAX(LEN([Zone])) AS zone_len,
    MAX(LEN([service_zone])) AS sz_len
FROM OPENROWSET(
    BULK 'https://syanpsecoursedlblaise.dfs.core.windows.net/nyc-taxi-data/raw/taxi_zone.csv',
    FORMAT = 'CSV',
    PARSER_VERSION = '2.0',
    HEADER_ROW = TRUE,
    FIELDTERMINATOR = ',',
    ROWTERMINATOR = '\n'
) AS [result]

-- specify data types and use smaller sizes to avoid exorbitant pricing costs
-- use the WITH CLAUSE to provide explicit data types

SELECT 
    *
FROM OPENROWSET(
    BULK 'https://syanpsecoursedlblaise.dfs.core.windows.net/nyc-taxi-data/raw/taxi_zone.csv',
    FORMAT = 'CSV',
    HEADER_ROW = TRUE, 
    FIELDTERMINATOR = ',',
    ROWTERMINATOR = '\n',
    PARSER_VERSION = '2.0'
) WITH (
    LocationID SMALLINT,
    Borough VARCHAR(15),
    Zone VARCHAR(50),
    service_zone VARCHAR(15)
) AS [result]


EXEC sp_describe_first_result_set N'SELECT 
    *
FROM OPENROWSET(
    BULK ''https://syanpsecoursedlblaise.dfs.core.windows.net/nyc-taxi-data/raw/taxi_zone.csv'',
    FORMAT = ''CSV'',
    HEADER_ROW = TRUE, 
    FIELDTERMINATOR = '','',
    ROWTERMINATOR = ''\n'',
    PARSER_VERSION = ''2.0''
) WITH (
    LocationID SMALLINT,
    Borough VARCHAR(15),
    Zone VARCHAR(50),
    service_zone VARCHAR(15)
) AS [result]'



-- need to find the default collation for our database
-- query the sys.database table
SELECT * FROM sys.databases

-- default isn't the utf-8 collation

-- change the collation by using the WITH clause
-- SPECIFY UTF-8 collation
SELECT 
    *
FROM OPENROWSET(
    BULK 'https://syanpsecoursedlblaise.dfs.core.windows.net/nyc-taxi-data/raw/taxi_zone.csv',
    FORMAT = 'CSV',
    PARSER_VERSION = '2.0',
    HEADER_ROW = TRUE,
    FIELDTERMINATOR = ',',
    ROWTERMINATOR = '\n'
) WITH ( 
    LocationID SMALLINT,
    Borough VARCHAR(15) COLLATE Latin1_General_100_CI_AI_SC_UTF8,
    Zone VARCHAR(50) COLLATE Latin1_General_100_CI_AI_SC_UTF8,
    service_zone VARCHAR(15) COLLATE Latin1_General_100_CI_AI_SC_UTF8
) AS [result]



-- CREATE NEW DATABASE AND APPLY COLLATION
CREATE DATABASE nyc_taxi_discovery;

-- switch to the database
USE nyc_taxi_discovery;

-- alter the db collation
ALTER DATABASE nyc_taxi_discovery COLLATE Latin1_General_100_CI_AI_SC_UTF8;


-- CHECK IF THE COLLATION RULES HAVE BEEN APPLIED TO THE NEW DATABASE
SELECT name, collation_name FROM sys.databases;



-- changed the collation to utf8
-- running queries with this db connected now should prevent any errors from showing up again
SELECT *
FROM OPENROWSET(
    BULK 'https://syanpsecoursedlblaise.dfs.core.windows.net/nyc-taxi-data/raw/taxi_zone.csv',
    FORMAT = 'CSV',
    PARSER_VERSION = '2.0',
    HEADER_ROW = TRUE,
    FIELDTERMINATOR = ',',
    ROWTERMINATOR = '\n'
) WITH(
    LocationID SMALLINT, 
    Borough VARCHAR(15),
    Zone VARCHAR(50),
    service_zone VARCHAR(15)
) AS [result]


-- Read data from file without a header
SELECT *
FROM OPENROWSET(
    BULK 'https://syanpsecoursedlblaise.dfs.core.windows.net/nyc-taxi-data/raw/taxi_zone_without_header.csv',
    FORMAT = 'CSV',
    PARSER_VERSION = '2.0'
) WITH(
    LocationID SMALLINT,
    Borough VARCHAR(15),
    Zone VARCHAR(50),
    service_zone VARCHAR(15)
)
 AS [result]

 -- querying a subset of columns
SELECT *
FROM OPENROWSET(
    BULK 'https://syanpsecoursedlblaise.dfs.core.windows.net/nyc-taxi-data/raw/taxi_zone_without_header.csv',
    FORMAT = 'CSV',
    PARSER_VERSION = '2.0'
) WITH(
    Borough VARCHAR(15) 2,
    Zone VARCHAR(50) 3
)
 AS [result]

-- using with to specify only a subset of the columns
-- specify ordinal positions and select a subset of columns from csv files
-- we now can name columns, know what we want to read and the order, and names as well

-- using the with clause to rename columns
SELECT TOP 10 *
FROM OPENROWSET( 
    BULK 'https://syanpsecoursedlblaise.dfs.core.windows.net/nyc-taxi-data/raw/taxi_zone.csv',
    FORMAT = 'CSV',
    PARSER_VERSION = '2.0',
    HEADER_ROW = TRUE
) WITH ( 
    location_id SMALLINT 1,
    borough VARCHAR(15) 2,
    zone VARCHAR(50) 3,
    service_zone VARCHAR(15) 4
)AS [result]


-- instead of using header row as in the above code,
-- we can instead use the first row option where it'll be as if our csv doesn't have
-- a header and then thereafter we specify our own column names

SELECT 
    *
FROM OPENROWSET(
    BULK 'https://syanpsecoursedlblaise.dfs.core.windows.net/nyc-taxi-data/raw/taxi_zone.csv',
    FORMAT = 'CSV',
    PARSER_VERSION = '2.0',
    FIRSTROW = 2
) WITH(
    location_id SMALLINT 1,
    borough VARCHAR(15) 2,
    zone VARCHAR(50) 3,
    service_zone VARCHAR(15) 4
)AS [result]

-- DEBUGGING AND IDENTIFYING ERRORS:
-- limitation of the parser_version 2.0 when parsing error responses
-- might be better to try out parser_version 1.0 sometimes

-- use an external data source
-- create an external data source linking to your storage account 

CREATE EXTERNAL DATA SOURCE nyc_taxi_data
WITH (
    LOCATION = 'https://syanpsecoursedlblaise.dfs.core.windows.net/nyc-taxi-data/'
)


CREATE EXTERNAL DATA SOURCE nyc_taxi_data_raw
WITH (
    LOCATION = 'https://syanpsecoursedlblaise.dfs.core.windows.net/nyc-taxi-data/raw/'
)

-- NOW USE THE CREATED EXTERNAL DATA SOURCE INSTEAD OF THE URL
SELECT 
    *
FROM OPENROWSET(
    BULK '/raw/taxi_zone.csv',
    DATA_SOURCE = 'nyc_taxi_data',
    FORMAT = 'CSV',
    PARSER_VERSION = '2.0',
    FIRSTROW = 2
) WITH(
    location_id SMALLINT 1,
    borough VARCHAR(15) 2,
    zone VARCHAR(50) 3,
    service_zone VARCHAR(15) 4
)AS [result]


-- DROP DATA SOURCE
DROP EXTERNAL DATA SOURCE nyc_taxi_data;


-- to see where the external data sources are pointing, we can use the sys.external_data_sources tab;e
SELECT *
FROM sys.external_data_sources
